summary: The Suicide Prevention Act aims to address self-harm and suicide. It authorizes a pilot program for expanded surveillance of self-harm in collaboration with public health departments, including data sharing and disaggregation to inform prevention efforts. It also establishes a grant program for hospital emergency departments to provide self-harm and suicide prevention services, including screening, short-term services, and referrals. The bill includes provisions for technical assistance, reporting, and authorizations of appropriations.
